snippet: A look at the latest developments as the state awaits new Congressional and legislative district lines based on the 2010 census.
abstract: Update of New York State's attempts to redraw its political maps to reflect the 2010 census; lawyers for Assembly Democrats and Senate Republicans submit critiques of each other's Congressional redistricting maps for the judge to consider; civic groups and Albany lawmakers continue to debate whether Gov Andrew M Cuomo should seek to compromise on this year's maps in return for a constitutional amendment that would create an independent redistricting process in 2022.
lead_paragraph: A look at the latest developments as the state awaits new Congressional and legislative district lines based on the 2010 census.

headline.seo: Unmapped — Update on New York Redistricting
